summary: This introductory lesson establishes the foundational mindset for Tactical Agentic Coding. The core message: stop coding by hand. Your hands and mind are no longer the best tools for writing code. Phase 1 of the generative AI age was AI coding (using prompts to generate code). Phase 2 is Agentic Engineering - building systems that build systems. The lesson introduces the first tactic: Stop Coding. Engineers are not coders; engineering is about building systems of leverage that produce valuable outcomes. The lesson demonstrates the difference between AI coding (generating code) and Agentic coding (agents that can call tools and perform engineering work). It introduces Claude Code as a programmable agentic coding tool that can be called from shell, Python, or TypeScript scripts.
key_concepts:
1. STOP CODING: The foundational tactic. Your hands and mind are no longer the best tools for writing code. If you are still typing code, you have no chance of keeping up. Throughout the course, not a single line of code will be typed manually.

2. PHASE 1 VS PHASE 2 OF GENERATIVE AI: Phase 1 was AI coding - using prompts to generate code (vibe coding, cursor, copilot). Phase 2 is Agentic Engineering - building systems that build systems, where agents can take actions autonomously.

3. ENGINEER VS CODER: Engineering was never about writing code. It is about building systems of leverage that produce valuable outcomes for users and customers. The difference is massive.

4. AI CODING VS AGENTIC CODING: AI coding generates code from prompts. Agentic coding uses agents that can call tools, execute plans, check out branches, run scripts, and perform real engineering work - not just write code.

5. THE AGENTIC ENGINEER ROLE: A new role in software engineering defined by the ability to build systems that can take actions. The domain agenticengineer.com was registered in 2023 predicting this role would emerge.

6. CLAUDE CODE AS A PRIMITIVE: Claude Code is not just for writing code - it calls tools and does engineering work. More importantly, it is programmable and can be called from any language with terminal access (shell, Python with UV, TypeScript with Bun).

7. EIGHT TACTICS OF AGENTIC CODING: The course breaks down eight tactics across eight lessons. Each lesson unlocks prompts, commands, links, and assets in a loot box. Tactics stack on each other - some required, some accelerate capabilities.

8. COURSE STRUCTURE: Each lesson contains a codebase to follow along with and one critical tactic of agentic coding. The TAC (Tactical Agentic Coding) approach transforms phase 1 AI coding engineers into phase 2 Agentic Engineers.
